1030/A0/06/002/003.status_value: Achieved. By the end of December 2016 the Government of Croatia adopted National Strategy for Child Rights to address  inter alia  the 2014 Recommendations of the CRC. Additionally  the Government initiated work on adopting National Child Rights Indicators to address the gap in systematic monitoring of child well-being in the Country.
1030/A0/06/002/003.indicator_name: Initiatives taken by the Government and governmental bodies which result in a change of legislation  policies and/or practices in line with the CRC concluding observations
1030/A0/06/002/003.headline: In 2016  a strong alliance contributing to child rights in Croatia and abroad was further strengthened and supported by more than 76 000 individuals. By 2016  alliance for child rights in media is established with support of all national TV stations and under the auspices of the Agency for Electronic Media.

1030/A0/06/002/003.status_value: Overachieved. By the end of December 2016 $ 1 186 000 contributed to RR (12 times increase compared to baseline).

By 2016  alliance for child rights in media is established with support of all national TV stations and under the auspices of the Agency for Electronic Media.

1030/A0/06/002/003.status_value: Overachieved. By the end of December 2016  US$818 387.22 was leveraged for DRR  resilience and emergency preparedness and response in Croatia.

1030/A0/06/002/002.status_value: ON TRACK  The national expert working group developed the set of CWB indicators to strengthen national monitoring framework. Its further operationalisation is expected in 2017.
1030/A0/06/002/002.indicator_name: Status and quality of monitoring of National strategic document for children
1030/A0/06/002/002.headline: The set of developed national child well-being indicators supported national efforts to enhance child rights monitoring mechanisms and present a solid foundation for its further improvement.

1030/A0/06/002/002.status_value: The final draft of new Strategy for Children has been developed   ratification of the document is scheduled for the Q-4  2014.   The Council for Children is expected to (i) coordinate and monitor the Strategy  (ii) operationalize it trough development of three year action plans  and (iii) monitor and compile reports about its implementation.
1030/A0/06/002/002.indicator_name: Status of the implementation and monitoring of National Plan of Action for Children
1030/A0/06/002/002.headline: The set of developed national child well-being indicators supported national efforts to enhance child rights monitoring mechanisms and present a solid foundation for its further improvement.
1030/A0/06/002/002.baseline_value: Current NAP not based on disaggregated data  monitoring mechanisms not adequate  new NAP to be designed by 2013

1030/A0/06/002/002.status_value: ON TRACK  The National Strategy for the Rights of Children 2014 set measures to ensure social services that are evenly distributed in local communities as well as targeted and adapted to the specific needs of at-risk families and children (children with disabilities  children placed in care  children living in poverty  children in conflict with the law  children with a history of abuse and neglect  Roma children  children in families with disrupted relationships  high conflict divorces etc.)  In
1030/A0/06/002/002.indicator_name: Existence of mechanisms to increase inclusion of excluded children into social protection
1030/A0/06/002/002.headline: The set of developed national child well-being indicators supported national efforts to enhance child rights monitoring mechanisms and present a solid foundation for its further improvement.

1030/A0/06/002/001.status_value: COMPLETED  The by-law within the Family Law adopted in September 2015 regulates implementation of the social welfare intervention (supervision over parental care). The intervention was additionally improved within the Law and guidelines and social work instruments are provided within the by-law.
1030/A0/06/002/001.indicator_name: Regulatory framework (by-laws  standards and protocols) for implementing social welfare intervention (supervision over parental care)
1030/A0/06/002/001.headline: Noticeable progress achieved in strengthening child protection and justice system to apply child friendly practices  both in family based care and in justice for children areas  as reflected through output indicators. Additional contribution has been made in supporting emergency response to refugee and migrant crisis according to CCC.

1030/A0/06/002/001.status_value: DELAYED The process of ensuring continuous education  monitoring and support to foster care providers was initiated in the first half of the 2016  to provide grounds for legislation changes and improvements. Political instability in the Country delayed the process  which is expected to continue in 2017.
1030/A0/06/002/001.indicator_name: Regulatory framework (by-laws  standards and protocols) related to continuous education  monitoring  and support to foster care providers
1030/A0/06/002/001.headline: Noticeable progress achieved in strengthening child protection and justice system to apply child friendly practices  both in family based care and in justice for children areas  as reflected through output indicators. Additional contribution has been made in supporting emergency response to refugee and migrant crisis according to CCC.

1030/A0/06/002/001.status_value: COMPLETED  Diversion measure  Out-of-court settlement for juveniles in conflict with the law have been established in all 21 counties. Financial means for their implementation during 2016 have been secured through the regular budget of Ministry for Demography  Family  Youth and Social Policy.
1030/A0/06/002/001.indicator_name: # of counties providing diversion measure for youth in conflict with law
1030/A0/06/002/001.headline: Noticeable progress achieved in strengthening child protection and justice system to apply child friendly practices  both in family based care and in justice for children areas  as reflected through output indicators. Additional contribution has been made in supporting emergency response to refugee and migrant crisis according to CCC.

1030/A0/06/002/001.status_value: COMPLETED 10 key criminal courts are technically and staffing wise equipped to implement child-friendly procedures. In addition in 2016 the role of the criminal court staff (non-legal child professionals) who implement child-friendly procedures has been strengthened.
1030/A0/06/002/001.indicator_name: # of courts implementing child-friendly procedure for child victims and witnesses in criminal proceedings
1030/A0/06/002/001.headline: Noticeable progress achieved in strengthening child protection and justice system to apply child friendly practices  both in family based care and in justice for children areas  as reflected through output indicators. Additional contribution has been made in supporting emergency response to refugee and migrant crisis according to CCC.

1030/A0/06/002/001.status_value: Baseline 2011: 16 juvenile justice mediators in 3 counties  46% probation officers in charge of ICS measure provide adequate support and specialized treatment services   2013: Out-of-court settlement nationally scaled up: currently 55 juvenile justice mediators in all 21 counties (100% coverage) are trained for implementation of this alternative sanction  more than doubling the number of available juvenile mediators.  Research on the quality of increased supervision and care for juvenile offende
1030/A0/06/002/001.indicator_name: % juvenile probation officers providing children offenders with support and specialized treatment services

Additional contribution has been made in supporting emergency response to refugee and migrant crisis according to CCC.
1030/A0/06/002/001.baseline_value: To be identified (Research on quality of increased supervision of juvenile offenders  2012/2013)

1030/A0/06/002/001.status_value: Since development of the new Foster Care Law has been postponed for 2014  and due to delays with the new Family Law and the Social Welfare Law  as well as the internal reorganisation of the line Ministry  the existing law still regulates only two types of specialised foster care: for children with disabilities and for children with behavioural problems.   There is no official data on the availability of the specialised foster care in local communities  as well as on the number of foster families
1030/A0/06/002/001.indicator_name: % of towns and municipalities in selected counties providing and sustaining diverse and specialised types of foster care  in accordance to the specific children's needs

1030/A0/06/002/001.baseline_value: No specialised foster care types (No by-laws for the Foster Care Act 2011)

1030/A0/06/001/001.status_value: COMPLETED  The new model of parenting support programme for parents of children with disabilities  which was developed and promoted in 2014  is available in 29 cities/towns all over Croatia.  The Education and Teacher Training Agency (ETTA) provides training of professionals for implementation of the programme in kindergartens  rehabilitation centres and other institutions within the educational system. 36 new professionals were trained in 2016. 1030/A0/06/001/002.status_value: The new Law on Social Welfare from 2013 continues to hold provisions an early intervention services to young children and their families. However  the implementation and development of the regulatory framework is still put on hold due to the budgetary constrains. Also  there are no defined national criteria and standards of quality assurance for early intervention services and monitoring system.   In 2013  CO initiated the technical assistance to the Governments multisectoral coordination group

1030/A0/06/001/002.status_value: Official data on ECIS is collected only in the terms of beneficiaries. In addition  data collection method is either not described  unclear  or partial. A clear framework for monitoring the quality and access to early childhood intervention services in non-existing.  Mapping of the ECD/ECI services in selected counties will be conducted by the end of 2014 to determine number of ECI providers.
